FUN_140004150: The malware uses an XOR-based routine to decode hard-coded strings before use and re-encodes them afterward to hinder static analysis.
FUN_140002d20: It drops two certificate files with random names and a .crt extension into the %TEMP% directory.
It uses certutil.exe to import the dropped certificate files into the local Root and CA certificate stores.
FUN_140004720: It creates a new local user account named "UpdatusUser" with the password "admQ!23" on the compromised system.
It adds the UpdatusUser account to the BUILTIN\Administrators group to grant the attacker full administrative privileges.
FUN_140003d40: It locates the Firefox installation directory by enumerating the file system for the Firefox browser path.
It ensures the Firefox defaults/pref directory structure exists by creating any missing subdirectories under the installation path.
It creates the wincerts.js file under the Firefox defaults/pref directory and prepares it for writing configuration data.
It writes a preference line that enables Firefox to trust Windows system root certificates, thereby trusting the malicious root certificate that was installed.
